abstract: Democrats moved closer to a financial overhaul Sunday, with a potential deal to limit trade in derivatives. But Warren Buffet wants to protects bets he’s already made, The Wall Street Journal reported.
snippet: Democrats moved closer to a financial overhaul Sunday, with a potential deal to limit trade in derivatives. But Warren Buffet wants to protects bets he’s already made, The Wall Street Journal reported.
lead_paragraph: As Democrats moved closer to an overhaul of financial regulations Sunday, The Wall Street Journal reported that Warren Buffett — the man who once branded derivatives as “financial weapons of mass destruction” — has been fighting against the deal.

headline.main: Buffett Wants Grandfather Clause for Derivatives
